elements.content: Alkaline cation directed structural diversity of cubic-cage-based cobalt(II) metal–organic frameworks: from pcu to bct net†II Ji-Yong Zou Wei Shi Jing-Ya Zhang Yan-Fei He Hong-Ling Gao Jian-Zhong Cui and Peng Cheng 12–455,67891011,1211a–c13 Caution: 1415a R 1 = ∑(|F0| − |Fc|)/∑|F0|.bwR2 = [∑{w(|F0|2 − |Fc|2)2}/∑[w(|F0|2)2]]1/2.16Synthetic route of cubic-cage-based MOFs 1–3.III11a–cIII17(a) The coordination environments of Co(II) ions and Li(I) ion in 1 (thermal ellipsoids are drawn at the 30% probability level). All hydrogen atoms and [Co(H2O)6]2+ cations are omitted for clarity. [Symmetry codes: A: −x + y + 1, −x + 2, z; B: −y + 2, x − y + 1, z]; (b) the [Co8(TDA)12]20− cubic cage occupied by one [Co(H2O)6]2+ ion in 1; (c) the simplified cubic cage in 1 (TDA3− ligands are considered as the edges). Pink: Co; yellow: Li; red: O; blue: N; grey C.
